title: CRISPR Modification
description: A CRISPR modification altering sample genomic material. For example, CRISPRi dCas9-KRAB modification.

product_id.title: Product ID
product_id.description: The product or catalog identifier provided following deposition to addgene.org.

cas.title: Cas
cas.description: The name of the CRISPR associated protein used in the modification.

fused_domain.title: Fused Domain
fused_domain.description: The name of the molecule fused to a Cas protein.

modality.title: Modality
modality.description: The purpose or intended effect of a modification.

enum_descriptions.activation: The CRISPR system is used to upregulate the expression of a target gene via recruiting activating chromatin modifications.
enum_descriptions.base editing: The CRISPR system induces double-strand breaks at specific genomic locations to directly edit base sequences changing one base pair to another.
enum_descriptions.cutting: Involves using a catalytically inactive Cas protein to bind to specific DNA sequences and block transcription.
enum_descriptions.interference: CRISPR technique aimed at completely disabling a gene's function via recruiting silencing chromatin modifications.
enum_descriptions.knockout: The CRISPR system is used to disrupt or delete a specific gene, rendering it non-functional.
enum_descriptions.localizing: A form of CRSIPR gene editing that allows for precise insertions, deletions, and base conversions without creating double-strand breaks.
enum_descriptions.prime editing: A form of CRSIPR gene editing that enables the direct conversion of one DNA base pair into another without inducing double-strand breaks.

tagged_proteins.description: The tagged proteins in which the Cas nuclease is fused to an antibody.

cas_species.title: Cas species
cas_species.description: The originating species of the Cas nuclease.
